I wanted some inexpensive gloves for shopping trips, and to protect my hands from all the disinfectant wipes and sprays I'm using these days, and for when I'm loading "contaminated" laundry into the washer. I also use disposable gloves to clean up after the pets and handle raw meat and fish. They've served well. I also use nitrile gloves for certain tasks, and for work at my retail job. Using the cheaper vinyl gloves for quick jobs that don't require touch sensitivity helps me conserve the more expensive nitrile gloves for jobs that do. For those who haven't used vinyl gloves: They will fit much more loosely than a nitrile glove of the same size. They tend to cling to your fingernails and eventually (depending on use) start tearing where the nails poke through. Any chunky jewelry will tear them. Pulling them on too hard or with wet hands will tear them, as with disposable gloves of other materials.

Since 2020, my hands have been breaking out in a god awful rash. They start with tiny red itchy bumps, and end up with most of the hand/wrist being covered with severe redness/bumps, that often become flaky or crack and sometimes bleed. I’ve worked in a hospital for almost 9 years, so you can imagine the torture my hands went through, even more so with COVID. From my NP to a dermatologist, both thought my condition was either fungal infection or severe heat rash. I tried fungal, anti-itch, and steroid creams, along with specific creams for eczema and psoriasis- none of which which truly helped. Many months later (and a butt ton of money), I’ve discovered that I’m allergic to Nitrile gloves, which happens to be the only gloves my hospital uses because they’re generally powder and latex free. Since early this year, I’ve been using these gloves at work instead of the Nitrile gloves, and my hands have healed up tremendously! I’ve gone from looking like I’d dipped my hands in acid, to practically normal looking hands again. These gloves aren’t quite as durable as others and can easily rip if applying too much pressure with putting them on, so I went up to a size medium to avoid struggling with putting them on- easy fix!
